abstract: The hearing did nothing to illuminate the identity of the suspect trader, a mystery confounding regulators and complicating the case. No one appeared in court on Friday to represent or defend the traders.
snippet: The hearing did nothing to illuminate the identity of the suspect trader, a mystery confounding regulators and complicating the case. No one appeared in court on Friday to represent or defend the traders.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A federal judge has upheld the Securities and Exchange Commission‘s recent action against a Swiss account linked to possible insider trading in the $23 billion takeover of H.J. Heinz, the agency announced on Friday.

headline.main: Judge Upholds S.E.C. Freeze on Account Tied to Suspicious Heinz Trades
headline.print_headline: Judge Continues Freeze On Account Over Heinz Trades
